ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: SRT: Total Recall Score
SRT: Total Recall T-Score
SRT: Long Term Retrieval Score
SRT: Long Term Storage Score
SRT: Consistent Long-term Recall Score
SRT Percentile Rank
Long Term Storage Corrected for Gender (male) and Age
Long Term Storage percentile corrected for gender (male) and age
Consistent Long-term Recall Score corrected for gender (male) and age
Consistent Long-term Recall percentile corrected for gender (male) and age
Number of words participant correctly recalled from the final  trial
Total number of intrusions (a word that is not on the list of words to memorize)
Number of unique, different intrusions (a word that is not on the list of words to memorize)
SRT: Delayed Recall Score
SRT: Delayed Recall T-score
SRT: Delayed recognition score
